title: Very heavy showers above 150 mm expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says rainy condition is expected to continue further in Northern, North-central, Eastern,Uva and Central provinces.

title: PM Harini pledges justice for all people of the country
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya said that it is the Government’s intention to provide justice to the people who are deprived of the same due to rewards and sponsorships.

title: Fuel tanker truck blast kills at least 70 in Nigeria
byline: At least 70 people were killed and more injured in northern Nigeria on Saturday when a petrol tanker truck overturned, spilling fuel that exploded, the country’s national emergency agency said.

title: Landslide early warnings issued for 4 districts
byline: The National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for multiple areas in several districts, as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Four districts severely affected by heavy rainfall
byline: Four districts of the island have been severely affected by the prevailing inclement weather conditions.

title: Flood warnings issued for low-lying areas of Mahaweli River
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a flood warning for several low-lying areas of Mahaweli River Basins, effective until 7.30 a.m. on January 21, 2025.

title: 35 injured as two buses collide head-on in Gandara
byline: At least 35 people have been injured and hospitalised following a head-on collision involving two private buses on the Matara-Tangalle main road at Talalla, Gandara.

title: Five sluice gates opened in Senanayake Samudraya
byline: Five sluice gates of the Senanayake Samudraya have been opened following heavy rainfall.

title: Several trains cancelled for third straight day
byline: The Railway Department announced that several train services have been cancelled once again today (19).

title: Israeli PM says ceasefire will not start until Hamas releases hostage list
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Gaza’s ceasefire, due to start at 0630 GMT on Sunday, will not begin until the Palestinian militant group Hamas provides a list of hostages to be released.

title: Warning issued for heavy rainfall in several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ warning for heavy rains in Eastern, Uva and North-Central provinces and Hambantota, Mannar and Vavuniya districts today (19).

title: One dead in shooting at Mount Lavinia; Gunman arrested
byline: UPDATE (1.35 p.m.):  Police stated that the person who was injured in the shooting incident at Siripala Mawatha in Mount Lavinia today has succumbed to his injuries.

title: Former Minister Vijith Wijayamuni Soysa arrested
byline: Former Minister Vijith Wijayamuni Soysa has been arrested by the Walana Anti-Vice Unit today (19), police said.

title: Two dead after car plunges into river in Kandy
byline: Two persons have been reported dead following a vehicle accident at Panwila in Kandy, police said.

title: Gaza ceasefire begins after delay as Hamas names hostages to be released Sunday
byline: A long-awaited ceasefire in Gaza began after a three-hour delay as Hamas named the three female hostages it plans to free later on Sunday.

title: Schools closed tomorrow in Eastern Province
byline: Due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions, all government schools in the Eastern Province have been granted a holiday tomorrow (January 20), the Governor of the Eastern Province said.

title: TikTok goes dark as US ban takes effect
byline: Millions of TikTok users in the United States are no longer able to watch videos on the social media platform as a federal ban on the immensely popular app takes effect.

title: Three including army soldier arrested over Mannar double murder
byline: Three suspects have been arrested in connection with the recent shooting incident in Mannar which left two persons dead and injured two others, police said today.

title: Veteran journalist Victor Ivan passes away
byline: Veteran journalist and former Editor of the ‘Ravaya’ newspaper, Victor Ivan has passed away at the age of 75, family members confirmed to Ada Derana.

title: More details revealed on Mount Lavinia shooting incident
byline: More information has come to light regarding the shooting incident that occurred at Siripala Mawatha in Mount Lavinia today (19), which claimed the life of a youth.

title: ‘Red’ flood warning issued for low-lying areas of Malwathu Oya
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a ‘Red’ flood warning for several low-lying areas of the Malwathu Oya Basin, effective until 4.30 p.m. on January 21, 2025.

title: Landslide early warnings issued for several areas in 4 districts
byline: The National Building and Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued early landslide warnings for multiple areas in several districts, as heavy rainfall continues in parts of the island.

title: Schools closed in North Central Province tomorrow
byline: All government schools in the North Central Province will remain closed tomorrow (January 20) in view of the prevailing adverse weather conditions, the Provincial Director of Education announced.
